Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Only assert HTTP 400 for bad cookies since behavior is flaky in App Service" (#8981) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Some of these bad cookies cause flaky error responses. It's not important enough to chase down why do we'll make the tests less specific.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/152621108-8791e3b0-2567-4759-bcc9-6ccbdc3b634f.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/152621141-db33c5f2-bf1f-4b7e-b790-6e6ef189d0c8.png)

Also enable TLS 1.2 in another static constructor. This makes running some individual tests possible.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Help Us Improve Our Open Source Repositories!" (#8980) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We'd love to hear from those of you who participate often in our open source project and let us know know we're doing as maintainers.

Whether you've been involved for awhile now or you're relatively new to open source, please let us know about your experience by [taking a survey that will take a couple minutes](https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/8QTQTGJ?Source=NugetGallery).

Thank you kindly!

# Gallery

## Changes

* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8933 (tracked by https://github.com/nuget/nugetgallery/issues/8924)
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8948 (tracked by https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4212)
* https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/8954 (tracked by https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8923)

Changes without tracking issue:

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Incorrect link on NuGet TOU page" (#8963) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: On the NuGet TOU page (https://www.nuget.org/policies/Terms), the link in the ‚ÄúYour Privacy‚Äù section to the "Microsoft Privacy Statement" is wrong. The current link (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2180118) points to the ‚ÄúReporting Infringement‚Äù page. It should it point to the Privacy Policy page (https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521839) that‚Äôs in the footer instead. Confirmed with CELA.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Download counters not updating for pre-release packages?" (#8979) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

## TL/DR

It seems to me that the download counter is not working for versions of packages that are marked as pre-release.

The total download for a package that has pre-release versions but also "normal" versions seems to work fine, even though each pre-release version is stuck at 0 (zero).

Please note that the usual delay of 24/48h for the stats to be updated is already passed, since we are at around 6 days.
Also, in these 6 days the other downloads seem to have been updated just fine: I'm talking about my **global** downloads, the downloads for each **package as a whole**, and the downloads for each **package version** that is NOT a pre-release version.


## The setup

Up until last week I had 3 packages on nuget.org , all of them had some versions released in the last year, and none of those versions were pre-release (per semantic versioning).

All was fine.

Last week (Jan 27th to be precise) I uploaded 2 completely new packages (both with a pre-release version) and 3 new versions (again, all pre-release) of the 3 existing packages.
So all of these were in "alpha1" version.
Then about 3 days after that i pushed another pre-release version ("alpha2") for all of the 5 packages.

You can see all 5 of them [here](https://www.nuget.org/profiles/jodydonetti) (screenshot taken 2022-02-02):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152252639-1d57cb56-60c9-4d44-8e71-c5548df49e88.png)

(Now don't be fooled by the 0.1.9 you can see as the "Latest version" for the first 3 packages, since what is shown is the latest non-pre-release version, as I'm sure you know)

So, all these packages have an actual last version that is pre-release (currently "alpha2").


## The Problem

The problem is that since then, the download counters for each pre-releae version remained stuck at 0 (zero), even though me and other people already downloaded them.

See screenshots below for some evidence.

### Repro Steps

Hypothetically:
- upload a new pre-release version of an existing package OR upload a completely new package (with a pre-release version)
- make some downloads
- wait a couple of days
- download stats will not increase

### Expected Behavior

Download stats SHOULD increase.

### Screenshots

## New package

Downloads for one of the new packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache.Backplane.StackExchangeRedis/0.1.0-alpha2)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152254941-84a73ae1-4146-495c-8c6a-8de0828ef696.png)

## Existing package

Downloads for one of the existing packages ([this](https://www.nuget.org/packages/ZiggyCreatures.FusionCache/0.1.9)) after 6 days:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010086/152255046-23f4fcda-e4cc-4c13-957e-a64710c3129f.png)

Note that as, I said above, in the last 6 days the downloads for the v0.1.9 kept increasing.

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Upload Package_Custom_Screenreader : Narrator is not announcing error message." (#8923) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1438007

### Repro Steps

1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/ 
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
1. Select ‚ÄúUpload Package‚Äù from the Profile Dropdown and hit enter.
1. Tab navigate to "Custom" control and hit enter.
1. Check After press enter on preview button then getting error message and that error message narrator is announcing or not. 

After press enter on "Preview" button then getting error message and that error message narrator is not announcing. 

Only screenreader user will difficult to know the error message.

### Expected Behavior

Narrator should be announce error message.


### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Adds User's MFA status when an API key is created" (#8947) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4179

- Created a new `WasCreatedSecurely` column in the Credentials table
- If a user's current session was Multi Factor Authenticated when creating an API key, the table logs a `True` in the `WasCreatedSecurely` column, and `False` otherwise. All entries before the rollout of this feature will be marked `NULL`.
- Added unit tests (for the `False` case when a user isn't MFA'd, simply adapted an existing test)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_.Json_Version History_Screenreader : Narrator is not announcing column name as column header for "Version and Downloads"." (#8922) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

Source: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1438720

### Repro Steps

1. Hit the URL: https://www.nuget.org/ 
1.  Tab navigate to "Sign in" control and hit enter.
1.  Tab navigate to "Sign in with Microsoft" control and hit enter.
1.  Search for a key term (say ‚Äújson‚Äù) from search box.
1.  Click on "Newtonsoft.json" control and hit enter.
1.  Tab navigate to "Version History" control and hit enter.
1.  Turn on Narrator
1. Check Narrator is announcing column name as column header for "Version and Downloads".

Narrator is not announcing column name as column header for "Version and Downloads" column.

Note:
No issue observed in NVDA 
This issue is also reproducing in Statistics page also.



### Expected Behavior

Narrator should be announce column name as column header for "Version and Downloads" column.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[DCR]: NuGet-based MSBuild project SDK resolver should run after .NET SDK resolver" (#11566) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Affected

NuGet.exe, MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### Current Behavior

Currently the NuGet-based MSBuild project SDK resolver runs _before_ the .NET SDK resolver.  The intention was that a user could override built-in SDKs with their own or we could ship official SDKs as NuGet packages.  However, after years of this SDK infrastructure being available, it is extremely unlikely we'll be changing how SDKs are shipped.



### Desired Behavior

Instead, we should make the NuGet-based MSBuild project SDK resolver run _after_ the .NET SDK resolver so that if a user is using a built-in SDK like `Microsoft.NET.Sdk` then its resolved faster.  There is a bit of overhead with the NuGet-based MSBuild project SDK resolver so avoiding it when we know the SDK is just built-in is a win for customers.

### Additional Context

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: CPVM: Directory.Packages.props Imports aren't being respected" (#11560) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

dotnet 6.0.1, nuget 6.0.0.280, msbuild 16.11.1+3e40a09f8

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

I have an existing code base that used a combination of `Directory.Build.targets` files to achieve a pre-cursor to what CPVM does.
The main repo folder has one such file with a bunch of `<PackageReference Update="A" Version="1.0.0" />` directives and each solution/project that needs to specialize/override anything has their own copy with **an import directive to the baseline file**, i.e. `<Import Project="../Directory.Build.targets" />`.

When migrating that codebase to use CPVM, I followed the same pattern with the `Directory.Packages.props` files, assuming the `Import` will apply in the same order and behavior.

This seems to not be the case, As the baseline version of a package "wins" over the nearest version defined in an inner `props` file.

I've made a simple repro to showcase the issue with Newtonsoft.Json v12 and v13, Where i try to use a type that only exists in the latter in one project.

**Expected**: The build completes successfully, Meaning the project with the specific `Directory.Packages.props` with v13 was applied properly.

**Actual**: The build failes on the missing type, Meaning the baseline v12 was applied.

Steps to repro:

1. Checkout the repo @ https://github.com/ransagy/TestCPVMHierarchy
2. Try to build the repo with `dotnet build`
3. Note the failure, Remove the `Import` directive from `Console\Directory.Packages.props`
4. Build again, This time it passes successfully.

I know there is an open issue on version overriding specifically for CPVM, But i didn't feel this comes from the same source.

There is an `msbuild.log` file in the repro that is the output of `dotnet build` in my case as an example.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_
